Description: Finely fashioned, small bronze axe-head: with wide butt and narrower cutting end. The sides are bevelled. The cutting edge is well shaped but is not very sharp and shows no signs of wear. The piece is lightly corroded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to have come from)
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (161)
